content:
Hi, currently I'm making a mock-up design for zulip-archive and need some feedback

The constraints I used here is: simple and nice
The underlined text is a clickable link.
The logo is also clickable, which will direct the user to the homepage

Home page:
Home.png

Stream page:
Stream.png

My friend suggested to use tables on Home and Stream pages, and I experimented a bit with it, I also think it is nicer to use table:
Home-table.png
Stream-table.png

Topic page:
Topic.png

I just recently thought it is nicer to place the focus more on the stream title and the topic directly instead of the text "Stream:" and "Topic:":
Topic-More-focus-on-the-stream-and-topic-name.png
Stream-table-focused.png

I'd be very happy if anyone could give a feedback to these!
(I forgot to make the messages date in the Topic page to be gray)
(Per https://github.com/zulip/zulip-archive/issues/14, I also forgot to put the latest message date for each stream in the homepage)
I don't know what is Archive and not able to suggest any design about that fast. So any structural approach to such page with a proper classes which later we could update css would be good.
I was thinking if you could uncollapse/collapse the stream name to show the topics list, much like the left sidebar of the webapp.

Vlad Korobov said:

I don't know what is Archive and not able to suggest any design about that fast. So any structural approach to such page with a proper classes which later we could update css would be good.

Alright, btw fyi in case you're interested about it: https://github.com/zulip/zulip-archive . Essentially it's a tool to archive chats in a zulip instance. For a live sample: https://juliacommunity.github.io/zulip-archive/ (from Julia community)

Rein Zustand said:

I was thinking if you could uncollapse/collapse the stream name to show the topics list, much like the left sidebar of the webapp.

I see, I also think that would be neat, but I'm also afraid that the page size will be very huge for a big Zulip chat instance like CZO that has many streams and topics
For the color scheme, let's use something in the direction of the Zulip blue, rather than the green that used to be our brand color a few years ago.
How did you pick the fonts? It might be best to use the font/heading styles from the Zulip landing page.
Alright, thanks! gonna change it to blue.

For the fonts I picked all of them from the landing page and used the "Extra Light" font-weight of it for the header. I'll try to use the same font weight as in the landing page and we'll see how it look

Here's the modified version of it (I only changed the important header to use font-weight: regular):
Home.png Stream.png Topic.png

And here is the one that uses font-weight: regular on every header:
Home-font-regular.png Stream-font-regular.png Topic-font-regular.png

I also experimented a bit with uppercase letter and modified some font-weights based on the how important the information is. For example, in home page, people might want to focus more on the table but still want to know a little bit that the table is actually containing "Streams".
Home-experiment.png Stream-experiment.png Topic-experiment.png
BTW, FYI, for the color I used #50ADFF, I took it from the first color in the current zulip svg logo, wasn't quite sure if it's the one to pick

I also just experimented to mimic the Zulip's login view, putting it here to see if anyone likes it
Home-experiment1.png
I have no strong opinion on the look and feel. Most mailing archives look nasty (e.g. https://www.mail-archive.com/django-updates@googlegroups.com/), and so, the bar is pretty low.
I agree that one looks really unreadable

Rafid Aslam said:

BTW, FYI, for the color I used #50ADFF, I took it from the first color in the current zulip svg logo, wasn't quite sure if it's the one to pick

Good question. I think we generally go for the midpoint color, when we're picking a single color from the logo.
Yeah, I don't know if Vlad Korobov or anyone has another suggestion, but that blue looks lighter than we'd like to me.
(And just to connect the dots explicitly: the color at the midpoint of the logo's gradient will be darker and purpler than that blue that's from the start of the gradient.)

Alright, this is the same previous mockup but with a slightly darker variant from the gradient (#5991FF) (I used this tool to get it). What do you all think?

Home-experiment-midpoint-color.png Stream-experiment-midpoint-color.png Topic-experiment-midpoint-color.png
I guess if there's no more feedback yet, we can safely start discussing on how it will be implemented? fyi @Rein Zustand @Tim Abbott

Here are a few bits of formatting feedback.

In the second screenshot:

  • I don't think we need the TOPICS overall heading, since that info is contained in the column heading.
  • The second column can just be "# of messages"
  • Maybe something like "Last message sent on" for the last column?

In the third screenshot:

  • Let's try something like "View in Zulip â†—" instead of "(show in Zulip)", perhaps colored like a link.
  • Is the date underlined because it's also a link? If so, does it go to the same place as the "show in Zulip" link?
Looks like a big improvement from the current UI!
You can probably start the implementation, and being able to experiment with a prototype may help us make further tweaks/refinements.

Thanks for the feedback, gonna edit the mockup and the implementation.

Is the date underlined because it's also a link? If so, does it go to the same place as the "show in Zulip" link?

Yes, it's a permalink to a message item in the archive, e.g https://juliacommunity.github.io/zulip-archive/stream/274208-helpdesk-(published)/topic/.E2.9C.94.20Default.20library.20path.20for.20.60ccall.60.20and.20.60llvmcall.60.html#290692706

It doesn't go to the same place as the "show in Zulip" link

@Alya Abbott Here it is, I also modified texts that were colored #000 with #333 just like in Zulip's landing page, I think it is more pleasant to look at.

Home.png Stream.png Topic.png

I also experimented to make the stream name bigger (the same font-size as in the home page's "STREAM") for more visibility of the stream name.

Stream-stream-big-text.png
Sure! It seems fine to me to start working towards this, and iterate from there.

@Rafid Aslam what do you think about doing stream > topic as the way that we display a stream/topic pair in its heading page, rather than having the "stream" and "topic" headings at the top? I think that's probably going to be a clean way to communicate what the place is without a lot of vertical space being wasted with headings and the like.
That sounds reasonable for me, I have been thinking about it this morning, but thought that it would make the stream and the topic text smaller. Anyway, let me try to make a mockup of it

We might have to assume that people who read the archive are more likely to have never used Zulip before. As such the concept of stream/topic might be unknown to them. But this concern is secondary to facelifting the archive layout.

It may be worth considering the stream prefix icons too? For a finite number of regular streams that would be particularly useful, since the # is likely quite well known as a 'channel' indicator by more people in any case.

We might have to assume that people who read the archive are more likely to have never used Zulip before. As such the concept of stream/topic might be unknown to them. But this concern is secondary to facelifting the archive layout.

That's a good viewpoint! I didn't think of it previously

It may be worth considering the stream prefix icons too? For a finite number of regular streams that would be particularly useful, since the # is likely quite well known as a 'channel' indicator by more people in any case.

Thanks! Gonna try to use it

Just tried to experiment with the new headings, any feedbacks are welcome!

I'm a little bit confused on what to put on the home page (the first page that the user will see), I feel that just putting the home icon there would feel too empty, so I provided a new alternative

Home.png Home-without-STREAM-heading.png Stream-hashtag-icon.png Topic-hashtag-icon.png
BTW FYI, the current prototype of the implementation is live at https://refeed.github.io/zulip-archive-design-proto/
I think the stream list should have descriptions of each streams.
That's a good idea!

So I just added the stream description directly in the prototype implementation, it can be seen here:
https://refeed.github.io/zulip-archive-design-proto/
https://refeed.github.io/zulip-archive-design-proto/stream.html
https://refeed.github.io/zulip-archive-design-proto/topic.html

I also tried to put rendered_markdown.css there as it turned out it also needed in the stream description.
The source is at https://github.com/refeed/zulip-archive-design-proto
I admit there are a few differences with the mock up I sent earlier, please let me know if something in the mock-up is better to be implemented in the live prototype

@Rafid Aslam I think a design that just has the description in standard font below the a heading size stream name, without the "stream" and "description" headings, might feel cleaner, and leave more space for the actual stream content, especially on mobile.
I will ask the opinion of Julia folks about the design prototype next week.

Tim Abbott said:

Rafid Aslam I think a design that just has the description in standard font below the a heading size stream name, without the "stream" and "description" headings, might feel cleaner, and leave more space for the actual stream content, especially on mobile.

Alright, just updated the prototype!

Rein Zustand said:

I will ask the opinion of Julia folks about the design prototype next week.

Looking forward to that!
@Rafid Aslam you can see their feedback in #julia > zulip-archive ui revamp.
You can post directly in that stream as well. It should get forwarded to julialang.zulipchat.com.
Thanks for the ping! Gonna read it
